p: Silva et al. [ 39]reported that the essential oil from the leaves of a specimen of L. thymoidescontains sesquiterpeneβ-caryophyllene (17.22–26.27%) as the main component, followed by borneol (4.45–7.36%), camphor (3.22–8.61%), camphene (2.64–5.66%), and germacrene-D (4.72–6.18%). This chemical profile is different from described in the present study. This is possible related to biotic and abiotic factors of the collection site of these two specimens; according to Ribeiro et al. [ 40], these factors qualitatively and quantitatively affect the yield and composition of secondary metabolites.
